title: Concern over Fukuoka Rugby World Cup pitch after Ireland players seen lifting strips of turf off ground
text:
Concerns have been raised over the state of the pitch for Ireland’s final Pool A clash against Samoa in Fukuoka on Saturday, with players seen lifting strips of it completely off the ground during Friday’s captain’s run.

Ireland were conciliatory in their press conference this morning, with assistant coach Greg Feek saying he “did not want to cause any more controversy at this stage” when asked about the pitch. But the players’ and coaches’ faces during the vision access part of training were clear enough. Joe Schmidt, Ireland’s head coach, looked particularly concerned.
